title: Woman who ‘stuffed partner’s severed head in box boiled and wrapped it in foil’
text:
María del Carmen Merino Gómez has been arrested over the package containing her partner Jesús María Baranda’s severed head (Picture: Solarpix/CEN)

A woman, who gave a box to her neighbour containing the severed head of her partner, is thought to have boiled and wrapped it in aluminium foil beforehand.

María del Carmen Merino Gómez, 61, is currently being held in custody after being arrested on Tuesday over the gruesome package.

She is thought to have given the box ‘full of sex toys’ to a neighbour for safekeeping, in April, at her home in the town Castro Urdiales, in Cantabria, northern Spain.

Inside the box was in fact the head of María del Carmen’s missing partner, Jesús María Baranda, 67, which reportedly had no human tissue because it had been boiled and wrapped in foil to disguise the smell.

Retired bank worker Jesús María – who had been missing since February – was identified by a tooth.

Officials are now investigating whether María del Carmen carried out the alleged murder, or whether she could have hired a hitman, according to El Nacional.

María del Carmen claimed someone left the gruesome box on her doorstep and she wanted to keep it as a memory (Picture: CEN)

A neighbour in the town of Castro Urdiales, in Cantabria, was given the box for safekeeping (Picture: Solarpix)

Investigators say the severed head appears to have been treated by a criminal ‘professional’ and question whether María del Carmen could have done this herself.

Police have now focused their search for Jesús María’s body on a rubbish tip in the holiday resort, after the suspect’s cleaner told officers she had been asked to help throw out some heavy black bags.

The cleaner claims she was called to start her shift early and asked to take out the bags four days before Jesús María was reported missing, according to Spanish TV programme, Espejo Publico.

She reportedly told a judge that the bags were so heavy they had to be dumped in multiple trips.

The TV programme reported that María del Carmen told officers someone left the box on her doorstep and she ‘kept it because it was the only memory she had of him.’

María del Carmen allegedly said the box contained sex toys (Picture: Solarpix)

María del Carmen insists her partner voluntarily fled and took €12,000 [£10,671] with him.

The case came to light after María del Carmen’s neighbour opened the box last Saturday after it began to smell.

Advertisement

Advertisement

But she was horrified by what she found and had a panic attack, before alerting police.

She claims María del Carmen gave her the box ‘full of sex toys’ to keep at her home because she didn’t want police to find it when searching her house in relation to her partner’s disappearance.

The victim’s cousin Carlos Ricondo told El Pais that María del Carmen told the family he had gone on holiday, but when they called his mobile they got no answer.

He said she told him the phone had broken after being dropped in the bath and was given a new number but didn’t think the texts they received sounded like Jesús María had written them.

The cousin asked the person to send an audio message to prove it was really Jesús María but they got no response and reported his disappearance to the police.

Additional reporting by Gerard Couzens.

description: María del Carmen Merino Gómez's neighbour was given the box 'of sex toys' for safekeeping but it contained Jesús María Baranda's head.
